"You're the jungler, the scapegoat for all losses that have ever happened since the beginning of recorded history. If even one lane loses, regardless of how many you help to win--and even if your team does ultimately win--it's completely your fault. Have fun, summoner!"
Jungle main, for the masochists among us who don't have a nagging significant other
...or for those of us that do and really are just gluttons for punishment.

I prefer to say we're the Batmans of the Rift, really. Specifically, the Dark Knight kind. We're whatever the Rift needs us to be, the unsung heroes who are seen as the villains after the dust has settled, but by necessity...Because, as we say, wounded and broken as we watch our laners (the Harvey Dents) both fall into toxic villainy and get the credit for the victory anyway...*but, the other team can not win.* We don't get credit, we don't seek glory. We just make things right, and while we may not like it, we're fine with always being seen as the villain responsible for the preceding events, anyway, even if things *did* ultimately turn out fine for the team as a whole.

It's still be nice if we were able to (manually) list the champs we use frequently.
Here are some of the benefits: 

1. People see a list of champs that show your style and get a feel for you. 

2. These champs can be highlighted and moved to the top of champ select when it's your turn to pick, solving the  problem of "champ groups" people suggest all the time.

3. When it's time to ban you can see the champs in your team's list highlighted to avoid denying one from an early pick.

4. Most people only play around <=5 champs at their top level in their chosen role, so the list doesn't have to be too big or cover many roles. 

5. Easy to implement storing a list of 5 champs, by the time of pre-season 7. 

6. No need for a year of research to find out if people want this.
They do have "pick intent" which is a much easier to understand (and unfortunately exploit) than the system you suggest.

Have four icons (or circle thingies? like the ult circles in-game?) of different colours to the right of the champion list. Each of the other 4 players should be given a colour.
If you hover over a champion, let's say Teemo, all other players who have Teemo will have their circles light up. Let's say jungler and ADC have him, and their circles are yellow and green. So yellow and green would light up.
